speedydeletioncommon.label: Speedy deletion
speedydeletioncommon.desc: Mark this page for speedy deletion only if it fits one of the criteria below. There is no catch-all – if it doesn’t fit, use PROD or AfD.

dba1.label: No context
dba1.desc: Articles lacking sufficient context to identify the subject of the article. (A1)

dba2.label: Foreign language articles that exist on another Wikimedia project
dba2.desc: Articles having essentially the same content as an article on another Wikimedia project. (A2)

source.label: Please add a URL for that source:

dba3.label: No content
dba3.desc: Any article (other than disambiguation pages, redirects, or soft redirects) consisting only of external links, category tags and "see also" sections, a rephrasing of the title, attempts to correspond with the person or group named by its title, a question that should have been asked at the help or reference desks, chat-like comments, template tags, and/or images. (A3)

dba7Person.label: No indication of importance (person)
dba7Person.desc: An article about a real person that does not assert the importance or significance of its subject. If controversial, or if there has been a previous AfD that resulted in the article being kept, the article should be nominated for AfD instead. (A7)

dba7Band.label: No indication of importance (musician(s) or band)
dba7Band.desc: Article about a band, singer, musician, or musical ensemble that does not assert the importance or significance of the subject. (A7)

dba7Club.label: No indication of importance (club, society or group)
dba7Club.desc: Article about a club that does not assert the importance or significance of the subject. (A7)

dba7Corp.label: No indication of importance (company or organization)
dba7Corp.desc: Article about a company or organization that does not assert the importance or significance of the subject. (A7)

dba7Web.label: No indication of importance (website or web content)
dba7Web.desc: Article about a web site, blog, online forum, webcomic, podcast, or similar web content that does not assert the importance or significance of its subject. (A7)

dba7Animal.label: No indication of importance (individual animal)
dba7Animal.desc: Article about an individual animal (e.g. pet) that does not assert the importance or significance of its subject. (A7)

dba7Event.label: No indication of importance (organized event)
dba7Event.desc: Article about an organized event (tour, function, meeting, party, etc.) that does not assert the importance or significance of its subject. (A7)

dba9.label: No indication of importance (musical recordings)
dba9.desc: An article about a musical recording that does not indicate why its subject is important or significant and where the artist"s article does not exist (both conditions must be true). (A9)

dba10.label: Recently created article that duplicates an existing topic
dba10.desc: A recently created article with no relevant page history that duplicates an existing English Wikipedia topic, and that does not expand upon, detail or improve information within any existing article(s) on the subject, and where the title is not a plausible redirect. (A10)

dba11.label: Obviously made up by creator, and no claim of significance
dba11.desc: An article which plainly indicates that the subject was invented/coined/discovered by the article"s creator or someone they know personally, and does not credibly indicate why its subject is important or significant. (A11)

dbg1.label: Patent nonsense
dbg1.desc: A page that is patent nonsense, consisting purely of incoherent text or gibberish with no meaningful content or history. (G1)

dbg2.label: Test pages
dbg2.desc: A page created to test editing or other Wikipedia functions. (G2)

dbg3Vandalism.label: Pure vandalism
dbg3Vandalism.desc: Plain pure vandalism including redirects left behind by page move vandalism. (G3)

dbg3Hoax.label: Blatant hoax
dbg3Hoax.desc: Blatant and obvious misinformation to the point of vandalism. (G3)

dbg4.label: Recreation of a page that was deleted per a deletion discussion
dbg4.desc: A sufficiently identical and unimproved copy, having any title, of a page deleted via its most recent deletion discussion. (G4)

1.label: Please add a link to the deletion discussion.

dbg5.label: Creations by banned or blocked users
dbg5.desc: Pages created by banned or blocked users in violation of their ban or block, and which have no substantial edits by others. (G5)

dbg6.desc: A page that needs to be deleted to merge histories, reverse a redirect, or perform other non-controversial technical tasks. (G6)
dbg6.label: Housekeeping and non-controversial cleanup

dbg6Copypaste.label: Cut-and-paste page move
dbg6Copypaste.desc: Cut-and-paste page moves that need to be temporarily deleted to make room for a clean page move. (G6)

1.label: The page from where the content was copied.

dbg7.label: Author requests deletion
dbg7.desc: Pages where the author has requested deletion, either explicitly or by blanking the page. (G7)

dbg10Attack.label: Attack pages
dbg10Attack.desc: Pages that disparage, threaten, intimidate or harass their subject or some other entity, and serve no other purpose. (G10)

dbg10Negublp.label: Wholly negative, unsourced BLP
dbg10Negublp.desc: A biography of a living person that is entirely negative in tone and unsourced, where there is no neutral version in the history to revert to. (G10)

dbg11.label: Unambiguous advertising or promotion
dbg11.desc: Pages that are exclusively promotional, and would need to be fundamentally rewritten to become encyclopedic. (G11)

dbg12.label: Unambiguous copyright infringement
dbg12.desc: Text pages that contain copyrighted material with no credible assertion of public domain, fair use, or a compatible free license, where there is no non-infringing content on the page worth saving. (G12)

url.label: Please add a URL for that source.

dbg14.label: Unnecessary disambiguation page
dbg14.desc: This only applies to disambiguation pages which "either": (1) disambiguate only one existing Wikipedia page and whose title ends in "(disambiguation)" (i.e., there is a primary topic); or (2) disambiguate no (zero) existing Wikipedia pages, regardless of its title. (G14)

dbr2.label: Redirect to non-permitted namespaces
dbr2.desc: Redirect from mainspace to any other namespace except the Category:, Template:, Wikipedia:, "Help": and "Portal": namespaces. (R2)

dbr3.label: Redirect from implausible typo or misnomer
dbr3.desc: Recently created redirect from an implausible typo or misnomer. (R3)

dbg8Redirnone.label: Redirect to non-existent/deleted page
dbg8Redirnone.desc: Redirect to a page that does not exist or has been deleted. (G8)

proposeddeletion.label: Proposed deletion
proposeddeletion.desc: Mark this page for proposed deletion if it clearly violates community standards.

blpprod.label: Proposed Deletion (Living People)
blpprod.desc: An article about a living person that has no sources

prod.label: Proposed Deletion
prod.desc: Uncontroversial deletions that do not meet any speedy deletion criteria

1.label: Please explain why this page should be deleted, and provide links to the relevant policies wherever possible

xfd.desc: Mark this page to discuss its deletion with other editors.

1.label: Please explain why this page should be deleted, and provide links to the relevant policies wherever possible
Please explain why this page should be deleted, and provide links to the relevant policies wherever possible
